channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Rational DOORS Next Generation
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Rational DOORS Next Generation

item.title: CVE-2017-1338|2024-09-16T22:24:50.153Z -- ibm -- rational%20doors%20next%20generation
item.description: IBM DOORS Next Generation (DNG/RRC) 4.0, 5.0, and 6.0 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 126246.

item.title: CVE-2018-1494|2024-09-16T22:15:37.924Z -- ibm -- rational%20doors%20next%20generation
item.description: IBM DOORS Next Generation (DNG/RRC) 5.0 through 5.0.2 and 6.0 through 6.0.5 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 141097.

item.description: IBM Jazz Team Server products use weaker than expected cryptographic algorithms that could allow an attacker to decrypt highly sensitive information. IBM X-Force ID: 192422.

item.title: CVE-2021-20347|2024-09-16T22:36:24.826Z -- ibm -- rational%20doors%20next%20generation
item.description: IBM Jazz Foundation and IBM Engineering products are vulnerable to server-side request forgery (SSRF). This may allow an authenticated attacker to send unauthorized requests from the system, potentially leading to network enumeration or facilitating other attacks. IBM X-Force ID: 194596.

item.title: CVE-2017-1753|2024-09-16T21:57:23.676Z -- ibm -- rational%20doors%20next%20generation
item.description: Multiple IBM Rational products are vulnerable to HTML injection. A remote attacker could inject malicious HTML code, which when viewed, would be executed in the victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting site. IBM X-Force ID: 135655.
